intro: Saxifraga daqiaoensis, commonly known as the Daqiao saxifrage, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing white or pale pink petals. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
